title: Ethiopia: Obama Visit Aims to Bolster Africa-U.S Investment, Trade Ties
text:
Rwanda: 'Too Early to Replace Kagame' 
The release noted that US is intensifying efforts to create an environment that enables greater trade and investment through encouraging regional integration, legal reforms that allow free flow of goods and services, greater transparency, and anti-corruption measures. 
According to Rice, the President will highlight his country's continued efforts to support young African leaders, increase access to electricity, deepen partnerships in food security and global health which are delivering results by reducing hunger and under-nutrition, improving child survival, and helping move people out of poverty. 
The President will also stress the importance of strong, democratic institutions, respect for the rule of law, fighting corruption, and US support for open and accountable governance, and respect for human rights across the continent. 
"This trip is an opportunity to voice strong support for the vital role played by civil societies and call attention to other important issues such as the global campaign to combat wildlife trafficking and to stress the importance of equal opportunities for women and girls," Rice said. 
After visiting Kenya, the President will travel to Ethiopia to reflect the fact that the two countries have a longstanding, strong bilateral relations. She said: "Among our shared interests are ensuring peace in South Sudan, fighting al-Shabaab and advancing Ethiopia's growth and development, as well as promoting regional stability." 
On Monday, in Ethiopia, the President will take part again in a bilateral programme with the government of Ethiopia, including an arrival ceremony, bilateral meetings with the President and the Prime Minister, as well as a press conference with the Ethiopian Prime Minister and a state banquet. 
"I also expect that the President will take part in a summit meeting with a handful of regional leaders on shared priorities, particularly the crisis in South Sudan and regional counter-terrorism issues,"Rice said. 
On Tuesday, the President will participate in a civil society round table, and at the African Union. 
The President will hold a bilateral meeting with the Chairperson of the African Union Commission focusing on sustainable development initiatives, including food security as well as activities being carried out to deepen economic and trade cooperation with Ethiopia in the broader context. Ethiopia
